header: But God Did Not Reject His People

verse: Therefore I say, God did not reject His people, did He? May it never be! For I also am an Israelite, from the seed of Abraham, the tribe of Benjamin.
God did not reject His people whom He foreknew!

header: There Is Still a Remnant Chosen By God

verse: “Lord, they killed Your prophets, they tore-down Your altars, and I alone was left, and they are seeking my life”.
But what does the divine-response say to him [in 1 Kings 19:18]?— “I left-remaining for Myself seven-thousand men who did not bow a knee to Baal”.
In this manner then, there has come-to-be a remnant also at the present time, according-to the choosing of grace.
And if it  is by grace, it is no longer by works. Otherwise the grace becomes grace no longer.

header: But The Rest Were Hardened By God

verse: Therefore what? This which Israel is seeking-for, it did not obtain. But the chosen obtained it, and the rest were hardened,
just as it has been written: “God gave them a spirit of stupor [Isa 29:10], eyes that they may not see and ears that they may not hear, until this very day” [Deut 29:4].
And David says [in Ps 69:22-23], “Let their table become a snare and a trap and a cause-of-falling and a retribution to them.
Let their eyes be darkened that they may not see. And bend their back continually”.

header: And Israel Did Not Stumble So As To Fall

verse: Therefore I say, they did not stumble in order that they might fall, did they? May it never be! On-the-contrary, by their trespass salvation came to the Gentiles, so as to provoke them to jealousy.
But if their trespass is riches for the world and their defeat is riches for the Gentiles, how much more will their fullness be!
And I am speaking to you, the Gentiles. So indeed to the extent I am an apostle of the Gentiles I glorify my ministry—
if somehow I might provoke my flesh to jealousy and save some of them.
For if their rejection is reconciliation for the world, what will their acceptance be if not life from the dead?

header: Their Branches Were Broken Off By Unbelief And You Were Grafted In By Faith

verse: But if the firstfruit is holy, the lump is also. And if the root is holy, the branches are also.
Now if some of the branches were broken-off  and you, being a wild-olive-tree, were grafted-in among them and became a co-partner of the root, of the fatness of the olive tree,
do not be vaunting over the branches. But if you vaunt, [remember] you are not carrying the root, but the root you.
You will say then, “Branches were broken off in order that I might be grafted-in”.
Well said! They were broken off by their unbelief, and you stand by your faith. Do not be thinking lofty things, but be fearing—
for if God did not spare the branches in accordance with nature, perhaps neither will He spare you.

header: They Will Be Re-Grafted If They Believe

verse: Therefore behold the kindness and severity of God— severity upon the ones having fallen, but the kindness of God upon you, if you continue in His kindness. Otherwise you also will be cut off.
But those ones also, if they do not continue in unbelief, will be grafted-in. For God is able to graft them in again.

For if you were cut off from the wild-olive-tree according to nature and were grafted-in contrary to nature into a cultivated-olive-tree, how much more will these, the ones in accordance with nature, be grafted-in their own olive tree!

For I do not want you to be unaware, brothers, as to this mystery— in order that you not be wise among yourselves— that a hardness in part has happened to Israel until the fullness of the Gentiles comes in.
And so all Israel will be saved, just as it has been written: “The One delivering will come from Zion, He will turn-away ungodliness from Jacob.
And this is the covenant from Me with them, when I take-away their sins” [Isa 59:20-21].
In relation to the good-news they are enemies [of God] for your sake— but in relation to the choosing of God they are beloved ones [of God] for the sake of the fathers.
For the gifts and the calling of God are without-regret.
For just as you once disobeyed God, but now were shown-mercy in the disobedience of these Jews,
so also these Jews now disobeyed in the mercy belonging to you, in order that they also now may be shown-mercy.
For God confined all in disobedience in order that He may show-mercy to all.

header: O The Depth of God’s Wisdom! To Him Be The Glory!

verse: O the depth of riches both of the wisdom and the knowledge of God! How unsearchable are His judgments and untraceable His ways!
“For who knew the mind of the Lord? Or who became His counselor?” [Isa 40:13].
“Or who previously-gave to Him and it will be repaid to him?” [Job 41:11].
Because all things are from Him and through Him and for Him. To Him be the glory forever, amen.
